Do this now, and contact the State Attorney General quickly before the 90 warranty on used cars (generally the dealer warrants the car for 90 days) runs out. This may not solve your problem but at least you will have tried. Good luck!

content: Did you sign any kind of paperwork or anything like that when you bought the car? Did you have the car inspected before you bought it? If you signed paperwork and didn't read through it and there is a "AS IS" statement, then then Lemon Law doesn't apply. It is understood with an "AS IS" purchase, that the product is bought with no responsibilities to correct any problems that may arise with the product lingering with the seller. If the car isn't worth it, sell it for scrap metal and get what you can for it. And next time, take the car to a mechanic and get a free inspection done on it... it'll save your rear more than it'll cost ya.

content: Some States have a "lemmon Law". If you buy a car and it is a lemmon then they have to take it back and make good on it. Check with the State Attorney General on this. Make certain that you make a list of the problems with the car, document all of your contacts with the car dealer ( including taking the car back to him,) Make certain that you have all of the paperwork for the car and be certain that you document all telephone conversations with the dealer. Do this now, and contact the State Attorney General quickly before the 90 warranty on used cars (generally the dealer warrants the car for 90 days) runs out. This may not solve your problem but at least you will have tried. Good luck!

content: Did you sign any kind of paperwork or anything like that when you bought the car? Did you have the car inspected before you bought it? If you signed paperwork and didn't read through it and there is a "AS IS" statement, then then Lemon Law doesn't apply. It is understood with an "AS IS" purchase, that the product is bought with no responsibilities to correct any problems that may arise with the product lingering with the seller. If the car isn't worth it, sell it for scrap metal and get what you can for it. And next time, take the car to a mechanic and get a free inspection done on it... it'll save your rear more than it'll cost ya.
